intro: Thapsia lineariloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thapsia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features finely divided, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
